title: Illustration of French slave trade - process

content.description:
Illustration from The Trade of America Through MarseilleA port city in France, or Explanation of the King’s Decrees, Regulating the Trade Which Takes Place From Marseille to the French Islands of America, Book Published in France, 1764

In the foreground are several African people on the shore of a large body of water showing various states of distress.
In the middle ground are several African people, also showing distress, in a rowboat being rowed away from the shore.
In the right background is a large sailing ship preparing to sail away from the shore.
Chambon, M. Marché d’esclaves, 1764, Engraving, Courtesy of Slavery Images: A Visual Record of the African Slave Trade and Slave Life in the Early African Diaspora. http://www.slaveryimages.org/s/slaveryimages/item/1983.
content.question: Which of the following best describes a result of the process depicted in the image?

choices.label: Africans had to be converted to Christianity and therefore were forced to change their religion.
Africans became the largest group of people to arrive in the Americas before the nineteenth century.
Enslaved Africans supplied labor for European colonies mainly on Atlantic islands such as Cabo Verde and São Tomé.
Enslaved Africans were transported primarily from one small region in West Africa.

content.answer: Africans became the largest group of people to arrive in the Americas before the nineteenth century.
